clues.text: Discovery Park, the largest city park in Seattle, is located on a bluff overlooking this large sound
Cockburn Sound off the coast of Western Australia is an inlet of this ocean
The Neuse & Tar Rivers drain the central part of this state & flow into Pamlico Sound
Partly located on Long Island Sound, this state's panhandle is where you'll find Stamford & Darien
Oresund, also called the Sound, features 2 big ports on the Danish side, Copenhagen & this one familiar to Shakespeare fans
He published "The Torrents of Spring" just months before "The Sun Also Rises"
This narrator in a 19th century classic says, "Tom and me found the money that the robbers hid in the cave"
Her poem "Daddy" with its Nazi imagery dramatizes the oppression she felt; her actual dad was a non-Nazi entomologist
Her poetry collection "Call Us What We Carry" includes "The Hill we Climb", read at Joe Biden's inauguration
Loosely based on historical events, this 1985 Cormac McCarthy novel is subtitled "The Evening Redness in the West"

rounds.category: THIS PIECE OF PAPER WILL TELL YOU WHAT TO DO

clues.text: This "junction", what's your function? As a court order requiring a person to do or to cease doing a particular act
Part of this job was issuing ukases, like the one from 1821 claiming all fishing rights off what's now Alaska plus most of British Columbia
This 4-letter order is Latin for "let it be done"; you hear complaints about arbitrary & unfair "government by" it
The Edict of Cyrus from the mid-500s B.C. insists on tolerance for those conquered by this, Cyrus' empire
In the gospel of Luke, "There went out a decree" from this ruler "that all the world should be taxed"
For actinium, it's 89
It's the more common Latin name for the lesser bear constellation
This 2-word compound is the main component of both limestone & coral reefs
It says that the volume of a gas varies inversely with the pressure on it at constant temperature
Copperheads belong to this group of snakes named for the heat-sensitive depressions on each side of the head
"Until I see you again" is the meaning of this French goodbye
Paparazzi know that a legal or moral issue that attracts vast interest is a "cause" this
"Good evening" is this 7-letter word combining the French for good & evening
This French phrase, literally "like this, like that", is used to mean "so-so"
This 2-word phrase refers to one involved in shameful behavior, perhaps like Dennis the Menace
Meaning "unsophisticated", it comes from the same Latin root as "native"
This adjective for non-physical love derives from the name of an idealistic Greek philosopher
From the Greek for "not a place", it's a place where mankind lives in peace & harmony

European country that calls itself "Osterreich", meaning "eastern kingdom"

Its 5-regions are Vestlandet, Ostlandet, Sorlandet, Trondelag & Nord-Norge
Lech Walesa worked in the Lenin shipyard in Gdansk, a port on this sea
Once known as the Enchanted Isles, they're famous for their unusual animal life
The 4 playing cards whose names are indicated by a letter
With road signs, yellow means warning; white, regulatory; & orange, this
The accent on the E in café is called acute, on the A in à la carte, this
These dance names are used in the international radio alphabet to indicate "F" & "T"
On a map, a circle with a star inside usually indicates this

The year Columbus landed in the West Indies, this first of the Tudor kings ruled England
In the 16th century the Janissaries formed the elite core of this empire's army

He co-wrote "The Autobiography of Malcolm X" before he wrote "Roots"
He was Manhattan borough pres. when elected NYC's first Black mayor, November 7, 1989
This actor who played Joe in the 1936 film "Show Boat" graduated first in his class at Rutgers
The first Black to sit on the National Security Council was this award-winning newspaper columnist
Members of the Church of England are properly called this, not Episcopalians
Tibetan Buddhists spin these hollow metal cylinders mounted on a rod that contain a written mantra
Also called the Feast of Lots, it memorializes Queen Esther's prevention of the annihilation of Persian Jews
In Christianity the doctrine that God has foreordained those he intends to save
In the Roman Catholic Church November 1 is All Saints' Day & November 2 is this

rounds.text: The name of these items that became a 1940s fad derives in part from a word meaning "to cut short"
